citations.narrative:
A metal canopy is provided as a shade structure for the goat and pigs. The base of the metal frame, that supports the
canopy, has two rusted, broken sections with protruding edges. These rusted, protruding areas of metal could harm the
goat and pigs housed within this enclosure. This damaged area should be removed to maintain the structural strength of
the base and to protect the animals from injury.
The indoor and outdoor housing facilities shall be structurally sound and shall be maintained in good repair to protect the
animals from injury and to contain the animals.

(c) Housekeeping.
The tops of the two shelters, provided for the coyote pups, have accumulations of dirt and grime present. These shelters
shall be cleaned and kept clean to facilitate the prescribed husbandry practices.
Premises (buildings and grounds) shall be kept clean and in good repair in order to protect the animals from injury and to
facilitate the prescribed husbandry practices set forth in this subpart.
BOTH OF THE ABOVE ITEMS ARE TO BE CORRECTED BY: JUNE 22, 2023
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
3.125(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
A metal canopy is provided as a shade structure for the goat and pigs. The base of the metal frame, that supports the 
canopy, has two rusted, broken sections with protruding edges. These rusted, protruding areas of metal could harm the 
goat and pigs housed within this enclosure. This damaged area should be removed to maintain the structural strength of 
the base and to protect the animals from injury. 
 
The indoor and outdoor housing facilities shall be structurally sound and shall be maintained in good repair to protect the 
animals from injury and to contain the animals. 
3.131(c) 
   
Sanitation. 
(c) Housekeeping.  
 
The tops of the two shelters, provided for the coyote pups, have accumulations of dirt and grime present. These shelters 
shall be cleaned and kept clean to facilitate the prescribed husbandry practices.  
 
Premises (buildings and grounds) shall be kept clean and in good repair in order to protect the animals from injury and to 
facilitate the prescribed husbandry practices set forth in this subpart. 
 
BOTH OF THE ABOVE ITEMS ARE TO BE CORRECTED BY: JUNE 22, 2023 
 
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the licensee.
